channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Economists predict Germany will return to growth this year
item.description: Respondents see gross domestic product in Europe’s largest economy rising 0.2% this year.

item.title: Gucci owner Kering sees stock jump after Renault CEO quits to lead the luxury group
item.description: Luca de Meo is stepping down from Renault "to take on new challenges outside the automobile sector" after five years at the helm of the company.

item.title: Trump administration offers details of its ‘golden share’ in US Steel deal, but union says it’s ‘disappointed’
item.description: The White House is willing to insert itself aggressively into a private company's affairs even as it has simultaneously pledged to strip away governme...

item.title: A record 360,000 students applied for a Goldman Sachs internship this year—and fewer than 1% were accepted
item.description: Being an intern at the investment bank is often a ticket to the upper realms of finance.

item.title: General Mills CEO Harmening: ‘We don’t sell Cheerios in the morning and then think about sustainability in the afternoon’
item.description: Also: Israel-Iran conflict enters fourth day, Trump orders more mass deportations.

item.title: Oil futures rise after Israel hits Iran energy facilities; stocks little moved
U.K. says there's growing electronic interference in Strait of Hormuz
